skill.name: cc-devflow-orchestrator
skill.description: CC-DevFlow workflow router and agent recommender. Use when starting requirements, running flow commands, or asking about devflow processes.
skill.summary: CC-DevFlow workflow router and agent recommender. Use when starting requirements, running flow comma...
skill.author: Dimon94

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only workflow routing guidelines and links to other documentation. No executable code, no file system access beyond its own file, no network calls, no command execution. Lowest possible risk profile.

content.user_title: Navigate development workflows with smart routing
content.value_statement: CC-DevFlow provides structured development workflows but users often struggle to know which command to use next. This orchestrator skill routes users to the correct workflow command and specialized agent based on their current project phase and task type.
actual_capabilities: Routes users to correct /flow-* commands based on project phase
Recommends specialized agents for each task type
Provides workflow state machine and progress tracking
Links to detailed documentation for each workflow stage
Supports requirement, project, and bug fix workflows
limitations: Only works within CC-DevFlow projects with required directory structure
Does not execute commands itself - only routes users
Cannot modify project files or run tests
Requires companion command and agent files to function

use_cases.title: Start a new requirement
use_cases.description: New developer unsure which workflow command to run first for implementing a feature request.

use_cases.title: Navigate workflow stages
use_cases.description: Team lead needs to understand current project phase and recommended next steps in the development process.

use_cases.title: Automate task delegation
use_cases.description: AI agent needs to determine which specialized agent to invoke for requirement clarification or technical design.

prompt_templates.title: Start new requirement
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to begin implementing a new feature
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to implement a new feature. What workflow command should I use and what are the steps?

prompt_templates.title: Check current progress
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to understand where they are in the development process
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm working on REQ-123. What stage am I in and what should I do next?

prompt_templates.title: Navigate to bug fix
prompt_templates.scenario: User encounters a bug and needs systematic debugging
prompt_templates.prompt: I found a bug in the login flow. How do I use the systematic debugging workflow?

prompt_templates.title: Delegate to agent
prompt_templates.scenario: User needs to generate technical design documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: I need technical design documentation. Which agent should I invoke and what command do I use?

output_examples.input: I'm working on REQ-123 and my PRD is complete. What should I do next?
output: Entry requirements: PRD.md must be complete (satisfied)
When ready: Run /flow-tech to invoke the tech-architect agent

best_practices: Use this skill at the start of any development session to confirm your current phase
Follow the state machine recommendations to avoid skipping critical workflow steps
Combine with specialized agent skills for detailed execution of each workflow stage
anti_patterns: Skipping workflow stages and jumping directly to coding without proper documentation
Using the wrong agent for a task - always route through this orchestrator first
Ignoring phase gates - the workflow enforces quality checkpoints for a reason

faq.question: Does this skill work with any Claude project?
faq.answer: No. This skill requires a CC-DevFlow project structure with /devflow directory, .claude/commands/, and .claude/agents/ folders.

faq.question: Can I skip workflow stages?
faq.answer: Some stages are optional like /flow-clarify and /flow-checklist. Core stages like PRD, tech design, and epic planning are required for quality.

faq.question: Does this integrate with version control?
faq.answer: The workflows reference git status for entry gates but do not directly execute git commands. Users run git commands manually.

faq.question: Is my project data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only reads its own documentation file. It does not access, modify, or transmit any project data.

faq.question: Why am I seeing a phase gate blocked error?
faq.answer: Phase gates ensure prerequisites are met. Check orchestration_status.json to understand which requirement document is missing.

faq.question: How is this different from other workflow tools?
faq.answer: This is a routing layer, not an executor. It tells you which command to run. Tools like GitHub Actions or Jenkins are executors.
